parameter.title: Save as
parameter.abstract: Select the target product format

parameter.title: Start date
parameter.abstract: Start date of the TOI. Used as queryable for the MERIS Level 1 catalogue

parameter.title: End date
parameter.abstract: End date of the TOI. Used as queryable for the MERIS Level 1 catalogue

parameter.title: End date
parameter.abstract: End date of the TOI. Used as queryable for the MERIS Level 1 catalogue

parameter.title: Perform re-calibration
parameter.abstract: Applies correction from MERIS 2nd to 3rd reprocessing quality. Default value is 'false'.

parameter.title: Perform equalization
parameter.abstract: Perform removal of detector-to-detector systematic radiometric differences in MERIS L1b data products. Default value is 'true'.

parameter.title: Perform Smile-effect correction
parameter.abstract: Whether to perform MERIS Smile-effect correction. Default value is 'true'.

parameter.title: Check for sea/lake ice also outside Sea Ice Climatology area
parameter.abstract: Check for sea/lake ice also outside Sea Ice Climatology area. Default value is 'false'.

parameter.title: Width of cloud buffer (# of pixels)
parameter.abstract: The width of a cloud 'safety buffer' around a pixel which was classified as cloudy. Valid interval is [0,100]. Default value is '2'.

parameter.title: Cloud screening 'ambiguous' threshold
parameter.abstract: Threshold of Cloud Probability Feature Value above which cloud is regarded as still ambiguous (i.e. a higher value results in fewer ambiguous clouds). Default value is '1.4'.

parameter.title: Cloud screening 'sure' threshold
parameter.abstract: Threshold of Cloud Probability Feature Value above which cloud is regarded as sure (i.e. a higher value results in fewer sure clouds). Default value is '1.8'.

parameter.title: Average Salinity (PSU)
parameter.abstract: If no climatology is used, the average salinity of the water in the region to be processed is taken. Default value is '35'. Parameter unit is 'PSU'.

parameter.title: Average Temperature (C)
parameter.abstract: If no climatology is used, the average temperature of the water in the region to be processed is taken. Default value is '15'. Parameter unit is 'C'

parameter.title: Check for sea/lake ice also outside Sea Ice Climatology area
parameter.abstract: Check for sea/lake ice also outside Sea Ice Climatology area. Default value is 'false'.

parameter.title: Write Cloud Probability Feature Value to the target product
parameter.abstract: Write Cloud Probability Feature Value to the target product. Default value is 'false'.

parameter.title: useExtremeCaseMode
parameter.abstract: If selected a neural network for maximum range of concentrations and IOPs is used. If deselected a neural net with limited ranges but less noisy for low concentration ranges is used.

parameter.title: Use climatology map for salinity and temperature
parameter.abstract: By default a climatology map is used. If set to 'false' the specified average values are used for the whole scene. Default value is 'true'.

parameter.title: Land masking expression
parameter.abstract: The arithmetic expression used for land masking. Default value is 'l1p_flags.CC_LAND'. Value must not be empty.

parameter.title: Cloud/Ice masking expression
parameter.abstract: The arithmetic expression used for cloud/ice masking. Value must not be empty.

parameter.title: Writes the Top of Atmosphere reflectances to the target product
parameter.abstract: Writes the Top of Atmosphere reflectances to the CC L2R target product. Default value is 'false'.

parameter.title: Write TOA reflectances to the target product as
parameter.abstract: Select if all output reflectances shall be written as radiances or irradiances. The irradiances ( = radiances multiplied by PI) are compatible with the standard MERIS product.

workflow.title: BEAM Coast Colour L2R Atmospheric Correction
workflow.abstract: This application runs the coastcolourl2r processor for the atmospheric correction. The result contains (normalised) water leaving reflectance and information about atmospheric properties
